name: SLAV DEFENSE
idea: The most solid reply to the Queen's Gambit! With ...c6, Black defends d5 while keeping the diagonal open for the Bc8 (unlike the QGD with ...e6). After ...Nf6, ...Bf5 develops the Bishop BEFORE ...e6. The Slav leads to solid, strategic positions where Black has no weaknesses. It's the favorite defense of Lasker, Euwe, and many modern grandmasters who want reliability!
errors_white: Exchanging cxd5 too early: releases the tension and Black equalizes
Ignoring the Bf5: this Bishop is Black's best piece, challenge it
Playing passively: White must use the space advantage
errors_black: Playing ...e6 before ...Bf5: blocks the Bishop forever
Taking on c4 without a plan: ...dxc4 should be prepared
Being too passive: ...c5 or ...e5 must come to challenge White's center
development: Supports d5 and prepares ...Bf5 - play BEFORE ...e6!
THE key piece! Develop to f5 (classical) or g4 before closing with ...e6
Nf6 attacks e4 and develops - natural move
Nbd7 (flexible, supports Nf6) is often better than Nc6
...e6 after the Bishop comes out - otherwise the Slav loses its point

traps.name: Bishop Trap
traps.desc: After 3.Nc3 (or 3.Nf3) Black MUST play ...Nf6 then ...Bf5 (or ...dxc4 then ...Bf5). If ...e6? first, the Bc8 is locked in forever! AVOID (Black): Always develop the Bishop before ...e6.

traps.name: Slav Gambit
traps.desc: After ...dxc4 ...Bf5, Black tries to keep the pawn. If 5.e4?? Bxe4! wins a pawn. White must play 5.a4 to prevent ...b5. AVOID (White): Don't play e4 too fast! a4 first.

traps.name: Meran Trap
traps.desc: If Black plays ...e6 without having brought out the Bishop, it's the Semi-Slav. The Bc8 is locked in but Black prepares ...dxc4, ...b5 (Meran). AVOID (Black): Either pure Slav (...Bf5), or accept Semi-Slav but know the plans.

variants.name: Pure Slav (Bf5)
variants.uci: d2d4 d7d5 c2c4 c7c6 g1f3 g8f6 b1c3 c8f5 c4d5 c6d5 d1b3
variants.white_plan: Qb3 attacks b7 and d5. After ...Qb6 Qxb6 axb6, White has a slight positional advantage with e3, Bd3, 0-0.
variants.black_plan: The Bf5 is active! Play ...Qb6 (exchange simplifies), or ...e6, ...Be7, ...0-0 and defend solidly.

variants.name: Semi-Slav (e6)
variants.uci: d2d4 d7d5 c2c4 c7c6 g1f3 g8f6 b1c3 e7e6 e2e3 b8d7 f1d3
variants.white_plan: The Bc8 is locked in. Play 0-0, Qc2, e4 to open the center and exploit the space advantage.
variants.black_plan: Prepare ...dxc4 Bxc4 ...b5 ...Bb7 (Meran) to free the Bishop. Or play ...Bd6 and attack on the kingside.

variants.name: Slav Accepted
variants.uci: d2d4 d7d5 c2c4 c7c6 g1f3 g8f6 b1c3 d5c4 a2a4 c8f5 e2e3
variants.white_plan: a4 prevents ...b5. Recover the pawn with Bxc4 and develop with 0-0, Qe2. Central pressure.
variants.black_plan: The Bf5 is out! Play ...e6, ...Nbd7, ...Be7, ...0-0 and the c4 pawn has cost White time.
